conclusion: For a straight current-carrying conductor perpendicular to a uniform magnetic field, the Ampère force magnitude is F = B I L.
Segment AB is in a field directed 'into the page'; segment BC is in a field directed 'out of the page'.
Each segment experiences a force of magnitude B I L.
The two forces are in the plane of the page and each is perpendicular to its own segment.
Using the right-hand rule, the two forces are directed symmetrically with respect to the perpendicular bisector of ∠ABC.
The angle between the two wire segments is 120°.
The angle between the two force vectors is also 120°.
The resultant force F₍res₎ is the vector sum of two equal-magnitude vectors (B I L) separated by 120°.
The magnitude of the resultant force is |F₍res₎| = 2 (B I L) cos 60° = B I L.
The wire ABC as a whole is acted on by a net Ampère force of magnitude F = B I L.
